---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I believe this is now ready for review and hopefully merging, so I am removing the "RFC" tag

Thanks for doing all this! I've had a look at the changes and it all LGTM. In case anyone is interested the zulip discussion of for this is [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Definition.20of.20a.20covering.20of.20a.20topological.20space.3F)

:v: loefflerd can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13591878842/job/37999734431)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13591878842/job/37999734123)
bors d+
Thanks!
bors d+
Is this necessary? If so, why?

Are you asking why the line is being changed (answer : purely cosmetic), or why the line is needed at all? If you are asking the latter, then the answer is that something fails a few lines later without it, for reasons I don't claim to understand. Perhaps it would be better just not to touch this at all.
Just the former, why it was being changed. I'm fine with it.

I think we actually want to place this in the `Topology` namespace. That's how, for example, [Topology.IsInducing](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Defs/Induced.html#Topology.IsInducing) are done. There was a Zulip thread somewhere about switch namespaced things from `TopologicalSpace` to `Topology` (but keeping the name of the class as `TopoogicalSpace`), but I can't seem to find it now.

`Opens` is in the `TopologicalSpace` namespace, though, and I think we should be consistent with that.

(To me, it somehow feels like `IsInducing` is saying something _about the topology itself_, while `IsOpenCover` is saying something about some other object which _depends on_ the topology.)

(I'm going to close this sub-conversation as "resolved" with the code as it stands, but if there's a future PR that moves `Opens` etc to the `Topology` namespace, I certainly have no objection to this getting moved as well.)

It's unclear to me whether we want this as a `Prop` on `u :   Opens X` or a structure on `u :   Set X`. I'm not saying the `Opens` version is bad, only opening the discussion.

If we keep the `Opens` version, I think it at least makes sense to have a constructor with `u :   Set X`.
```suggestion
def IsOpenCover { X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] (u :   Opens X) : Prop :=
  iSup u = 
```

I don't have a strong opinion on this one; I was mostly just following the existing code. What sort of syntax do you have in mind for a constructor? Maybe something like
```lean
lemma of_sets {v :   Set X} (h_open :  i, IsOpen (v i)) (h_iUnion :  i, v i = univ) :
    IsOpenCover (fun i  v i, h_open i) := by
  simp [IsOpenCover, h_iUnion]
```

```suggestion
/-- A space is quasi-sober if it can be covered by open quasi-sober subsets. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Sets): define open covers
